task: How to Find a Job in Mexico
step: Find the right job by looking for internet and/or newspaper postings related to your interests and skills.
Be open to write a note directly to the HR recruiter, attaching your resume and/or to the General Manager if the company has this information in their web page.
If you speak Spanish, write a note in Spanish.
Telephone interviews are good, but video calls are even better, so prepare the place that you could manage your interviews, avoiding kitchen, bathroom, bedroom or similar immediately.
Apply all the tests the company may require, and be responsible with the timing, always checking with the recruiter that they are receiving the results of your profile.
When you receive the job proposal, ask for the detailed incomes and taxes deductions in your local currency, this will avoid surprises for you in the future.
Mexican laws may differ for foreigners, so contact directly to the payroll responsible to have all explanations you need for tax administrations in Mexico.
Once you clear all your tax responsibilities, look for a place to live close to your office.

Downtown is not a safe place to live in many cities, so ask a human resources department good options to find a place to live, that is close to the office according to your budget and personal interests after work time.
The companies in Mexico may fix your permission to work, but if not, look for the closest Mexican Embassy to follow their protocol.
Although the nighttime is always fun in Mexico, and you can find many places to eat, drink, dance, etc., try to use taxis in the authorized places marked on the corners.

Many people speaks English in the big cities, but it's smart if you learn Spanish fast, and communicate through this language to understand the culture, the politics, the internal problems, and the way the Mexicans create personal relations.
During your weekends, travel the most that you can, and explore all available options due to the fact that this country is big, and you practically will never finish meeting every single corner!.
steps_predictions: get_knowledge you need for tax administrations in Mexico

task: How to Find Legitimate Banking Jobs in Nigeria
step: Familiarize yourself with requirements for entry into Nigeria if you are not a resident.

Consider registering with professional employment agencies and recruiters that specialize in placing individuals within banking positions.
Apply directly to individual banks within Nigeria that have job openings.
Persevere but be patient in your efforts to find legitimate banking jobs in Nigeria.
